definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: French polishing is made to order for instrument collectors, dealers and guitarists .
sentences.chinese: 蟲膠漆塗裝適合樂器收藏者，經銷商和吉他手掌握。

sentences.english: An abrasive such as automotive rubbing compound will remove the very thin shellac finish.
sentences.chinese: 像機車專用拋光研磨劑就會穿透原本很薄的蟲膠漆層。

sentences.english: She wanted to shellac the desk to protect it from water spots.
sentences.chinese: 她想給這張桌子上蟲膠漆，以防止它受水漬的影響。

sentences.english: This paper studied the effects of shell lac wax on the freshness keeping of eggplant.
sentences.chinese: 探討了蟲膠果蠟在茄子保鮮中的作用。

sentences.english: Experiment with shellac with tips from an artist in this free design video.
sentences.chinese: 憑藉與技巧蟲膠從實驗的藝術家在這個自由設計視頻。

sentences.english: The coating was a mixture of shellac and alcohol .
sentences.chinese: 這種塗料是蟲膠與酒精的混合物。

sentences.english: The shellac issue was one of the hot topics of chemical research at the turn of the century.
sentences.chinese: 蟲膠問題是世紀交替之際化學研究一個熱點課題。

sentences.english: Shellac is derived from the excretions of the Kerria lacca insect, most commonly found in the forests of Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 蟲膠來自紫膠蟲的排泄物，最常見的在泰國的森林。
